text: Michael Alig (April 29, 1966 â€“ December 25, 2020) was an American nightclub promoter and convicted felon. He was one of the ringleaders of the Club Kids. In March 1996, Alig and his roommate, Robert D. "Freeze" Riggs, killed fellow Club Kid Andre "Angel" Melendez over a drug debt. In October 1997, Alig pled guilty to first-degree manslaughter. Both men were sentenced to 10 to 20 years in prison. Alig was released on May 5, 2014. On December 25, 2020, Alig was found dead by his partner at their Manhattan, New York City home after overdosing on heroin, aged 54. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American people convicted of manslaughter Category:Businesspeople from Indiana Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Criminals from Indiana Category:Criminals from New York City Category:Drug-related deaths in the United States Category:Gay men Category:LGBT businesspeople Category:LGBT criminals Category:LGBT people from Indiana Category:LGBT people from New York City Category:People from South Bend, Indiana Category:People with histrionic personality disorder
